result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevon Armando Raybon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Trevon Armando Raybon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Trevon Armando Raybon was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 24 months initial confinement in cases 13CF2087 and 15CF666.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence. With credit for 4 days time served.
Concurrent with: concurrent to case 13CF2087, consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge if not already done.
Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation, if revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
RESTITUTION ASSESSMENTS ADDED TO DEFENDANT'S OTHER CASE (13CF2087): Restitution joint and several with Travis Raybon 13CF2086 in the amount of $300.00 paid to Mohamad O. by the end of probation.   if revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES,  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.

As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future.  Defendant shall not vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample to the State Crime Lab, if not previously done so.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Mohamad O. or his business, East Side Auto.
Court allows contact with Co-actor Travis Raybon with approval of Probation agent.

Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Anger management and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent to case 13CF2087, consecutive to any other sentence. FORTHWITH.  The first 5 months (STRAIGHT), the last 5 months, the Court does not object to electronic monitoring and makes defendant eligible for the Day Reporting Center.  Huber release privileges for work, treatment and school.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevon Armando Raybon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 30 months consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 4 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 12 months. 
 
The Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for a period of 36 months concurrent to case 13CF2087, consecutive to any other sentence.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include conditions of probation:
* As a condition of probation, the Court ordered   the defendant to serve 10 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to case 13CF2087, consecutive to any other sentence.  FORTHWITH.  The first 5 months    (STRAIGHT), the last 5 months, the Court does not object to electronic monitoring and makes defendant eligible for the Day Reporting Center.  Huber release privileges for work, treatment and school.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Mohamad O. or his business, East Side Auto.
*Court allows contact with Co-actor Travis Raybon with approval of Probation agent.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Anger management and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department

-Restitution joint and several with Travis Raybon 13CF2086 in the amount of $300.00 paid to Mohamad O. by the end of probation.   if revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES,  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered. 
- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation, if revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 24 months initial confinement in cases 13CF2087 and 15CF666.

- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated May 1, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in court with attorney Maayan Silver, appeared by phone.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for sentencing hearing. For reasons presented to the court. Case is adjourned for sentencing, Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-04-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.    Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 26 on 03-26-2015 at 08:30 am.
 
As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future.  Defendant shall not vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample to the State Crime Lab, if not previously done so.

AS TO COUNT 2 AND 3:  On motion of the State Court ordered Counts 2 and 3 DISMISSED.

COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Ron Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mary Schmitz-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/18/15.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
